title: Introducing python-in-browser
body:
Python-in-browser is a project I have been working on which allows you to run Python code in your browser, sandboxed away from your system.
 
I was inspired by https://github.com/raxod502/python-in-a-box, but python-in-browser has very few things in common. 
Python-in-a-box runs Python code on a server, so it has access to most of the good Python featues.
Python-in-browser parses Python code in your browser, so it lacks most of those features. 
The only good thing about Python-in-browser is the fact that it sends no requests to a server, so it works offline. (to some degree, and the page must be loaded with an internet connection)
Python-in-browser can be found at https://iam-py-test.github.io/python-in-browser, and the source code is at https://github.com/iam-py-test/python-in-browser

title: How to fix VirtualBox error 0x80004005
body:
If you have updated VirtualBox lately, you might have noticed that whenever you try to start a VM - even a new one - you get an error with the code 0x80004005.
But don't worry; your VMs are safe. There is a simple fix.
All you need to do is download version 6.1.26 from https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Download_Old_Builds_6_1 and install it.
After that, you will get alerts telling you to update, but until it is fixed, you should ignore them.
Note that version 6.1.30 is affected
Small note: While I was trying to fix this, I ran across a lot of weird 'fixes' which said to delete random folders, so be careful when looking for fixes on the internet.
For more information, please see https://forums.virtualbox.org/viewtopic.php?t=104228.
Hope this fixes your issue!

title: Removal instructions for "Discord Free Nitro - Free Discord Nitro 2021"
body:
"Discord Free Nitro - Free Discord Nitro 2021" is a theme for Chromium browsers which appears to exist for the primary purpose of promoting a scam website which claims to give you Discord Nitro.
While the theme does not seem harmful, you still may want to remove it.

How to remove it from Google Chrome
To remove this from Google Chrome, go to chrome://settings. In the sidebar, click Appearance.
At the top, it should say Theme. Click the "Reset to default" button next to that.
Your browser should now be running the default theme.
To be sure it is completely removed, go under 'Security and privacy', click 'Clear browsing data'. Be sure all boxes except 'Cached images and files' are unchecked and 'Time range' is set to 'All time'.

How to remove it from Microsoft Edge:
To remove this theme from Microsoft Edge (and reset back the the default theme, where you can select a theme of your choice), go to edge://settings, click Appearance, and then click 'Default' under Theme.

Remove this from Brave
Open Brave and go to brave://settings
Click on Appearance
Next to 'Theme' there should be a 'Reset to default' button. Click that and Brave's theme should have been reset 

How did this get on my computer?
This theme is normally installed from the Chrome Web Store by the user of this browser.

Hopefully this helped you in some way. If you noticed an error, feel free to email me. My email is iam-py-test@protonmail.com.
-- iam-py-test
